concept.title: About the DITA2Confluence tool
concept.shortdesc: This topic describes the primary use cases for the DITA2Confluence tool.

section.title: Intended use
section.p: The DITA2Confluence tool enables you to publish DITA XML content to the Confluence Enterprise wiki. It is designed for the following primary use cases:

ul.li: You want to maintain your content source in DITA format but you want to incubate the content with subject-matter experts and other contributors on a wiki before final publication to multiple outputs formats.
You want to maintain your content source in DITA format but you want to enable users to edit or annotate the content throughout its life cycle.
Your information assets are currently maintained in DITA format but you want to migrate the content permanently to a wiki.

section.p: Analysis about reasons for storing content in the DITA format rather than a wiki are beyond the scope of this documentation. See "Online resources" for a listing of blogs and other information sources about the subject. In general, DITA XML provides a richer semantic markup where wiki markup is designed to be simpler, and as such DITA XML meets authoring and publishing requirements that wikis typically cannot.
section.note: You cannot currently use DITA2Confluence to export wiki content to DITA XML. To accomplish that, you might look at the Mylyn Project which is an Eclipse plugin for exporting wikitext to DITA XML.

The DITA2Confluence tool currently supports the Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP) as its protocol for communicating with the wiki engine. Remote Procedure Calling (XML/RPC), which is not currently supported in DITA2Confluence, is an alternative protocol. For a concise comparison of the two protocols, see XML-RPC vs. SOAP

section.title: Features
section.p:
The DITA2Confluence tool includes the following features:
Easy-to-use command-line facility that can be integrated with automated build systems.
Sample DITA XML source for evaluating DITA2Confluence (this documentation).
Support for the DITA conref construct (referenced content is editable in the wiki output; referencing instances are readonly).
Generate a hyper-linked table of contents on the wiki based on DITA map hierarchies.
Build custom navigation structures, such as expandable and searchable trees, based on DITA map hierarchies.
Auto-tagging of published wiki pages based on metadata in DITA XML and specified by user.
Auto-commenting of published wiki pages.
Dynamic wiki space creation based on space validation (if a specified space does not exist, it is created dynamically).
Dynamic wiki space creation based on conditional processing (ditaval) rules.
Bulk deletion of existing comments, labels, or an entire wiki space (designed for development and test scenarios).
For developers: Test harness and build script for creating updated binary and source distributions when developing with DITA2Confluence.
For developers: Javadoc describing the Java interfaces, methods, and properties used in the processing (see ).

section.title: History
section.p: The DITA2Confluence tool was originally developed by Lombardi Software. Inc. in 2005 and then extended to provide its current feature set. It became generally available as a distribution of the open-source DITA2wiki Project in September, 2008.
